results.title: Proboscis
results.creator_credit: Rebecca McLean, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Penny Gosonski and her family had an accident on their way to their holiday destination. Apart from her father’s death, the worst fate Penny had to face was the loneliness of being the sole heir to the family’s attribute. A large nose that could send a thousand balloons into flight. Cast includes Julia Fernandez, Bree-Anna Obst and Phillipa Hagen.

results.title: Problems of the Middle East
results.brief_description: The four basic problems of the Middle East: minorities, agriculture, industries and education are discussed. The area has been the home of many civilizations each of which has left its influence on the cultural, religious, and social life of the country so that you get a number of ethnic groups proud of their history, language and religion and resisting the domination of ruling governments. The conflict between Israel and the Arab nation is discussed and the conditions of life is Israel are shown.

results.title: Problems of philosophy (TEFC): is mind identical with brain?
results.creator_credit: Mary Hoskins, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Professor Charles Taylor from McGill University, Montreal, challenges Anthony Quinton from New College, Oxford, to defend his views that mental events are identical with brain processes.

results.title: Problems of housing: the individual home
results.creator_credit: Harold F. Clark, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A study of the desirable and necessary aspects of homes: shelter from weather in all seasons, adequate ventilation without drafts, abundant light, protection from insects and aesthetic appeal.

results.title: Problems of flight
results.brief_description: Describes the use of the plane’s controls in taking off, climbing, banking, stalling, spinning and recovery, diving, gliding and landing.

results.title: Problem solving strategies the synectics approach
results.brief_description: Everyone has great creative potential but most of us do not use this because we are afraid of making mistakes. Certain strategies have been developed at Synthetics to overcome self-censoring. In the film we see some strategies in action during a Problem Solving Laboratory session.

results.title: Problem solving
results.brief_description: Problems exists in the day to day operations of all organisations and effective solution is what business is all about. Identifying the problem is easy, however analysis of the problem once identified is not so easy. This short program and trainer’s manual concisely identifies 5 problem solving tools; fault tree analysis, force field analysis, cause/effect analysis, repetitive analysis and sequence of events analysis and outlines which methods are the most applicable to different situations.

results.title: Problem Drinkers
results.brief_description: The story of what is being done in America to control alcoholism. The film follows, step by step, an alcoholic’s downfall and his eventual rehabilitation.

results.title: Probing the continental margin
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques of coring, trailing and seismic sounding used by scientists to survey and explore the mineral content of undersea landforms around Australia’s continental margin.

results.title: Prize winning advertising films: Montecarlo 1955
results.brief_description: Five prize winning advertising shorts as follows: 1. Prize for Television commercial films. Sooty the Bear: advertising Oxo extract produced by G. Street, Great Britain. 2. Prizes for puppets, marionettes and models. Mix der Grosse Zauberer: Star mix, an electrical mixer and grinder for kitchen use. Produced in colour by Fischerkoesen Film Produktion, Germany. 3. Pure Beaute: by Alexeieff; advertising Monsavon soap. Produced in colour by Cineastes Production Associes, France. 4. Diploma for entertainment value. The Beach advertising Shell I. C. A. Petrol. Produced in colour by Screenspace, Great Britain. 5. Grand Prix of the Festival. Le Choix de Paris; Jeunes filles en flour; Saloon bar; Le roi des caves Serie Rouge; advertising Vin du Postillon. Produced in colour by Cinema et Publicite.
